post.body: Huffington programming instrux: 1. Know famous people 2. Hire someone to program blogging site 3. Get famous people to write 4u
The problem with Qwitter is that when I stop following someone, it's not just one post that does it. It's a string of stupid posts
Sure, Christmas is great. I have two kids, and it's always exciting to see them open presents. Nice, fun family day.
Personally I don't like that style of background. Too much like an ad for me. But lots of folks have them, so maybe it's ok
God, look at that picture of Al Gore's office. I wonder how many tabs he has on those three 30-inch displays...
It was a spam purge - most people lost a bunch of followers
Becoming?
As drinkers 'round the world always say, it's 5 o'clock somewhere...
Is NeoOffice as slow as it used to be?
Another reason to block spammers from the start -- less decline in followers during spam purges
Ha Ha Ha! I wish.... I'm not a professor, but many people seem to think I am. Maybe I should get some grad students anyways...
Absolutely. The middle lane is for passing, and the left lane is for passing slow passers.
Heh, very cute -- never seen it!
Working fine here.
That has got to be my favorite bird name of all time
Yeah, I know -- sorry. It works, though, just doesn't offer much encouragement. May have to upgrade to WP 2.7
Here's the documentation, as requested! http://wordmunger.com/?p=1041 It's a little crude, but it was fun to make
#overboard, indeed. No, the polite thing is to tweet 60 min later
Obama filled his last cabinet spot. How's he going to stay in the news from now until inauguration? http://is.gd/cB31
As it turns out, I'm a freak for not always using tabs: http://tinyurl.com/4zl596
I just read all of the PLoS synchroblogging posts. Some amazing posts -- hard to pick one winner! http://is.gd/cy6x
Okay, you guys have convinced me -- I'm downloading NeoOffice. They ask for a donation before download -- at least let me try it first!
Had to kill OpenOffice from the terminal. These instrux came in handy: http://is.gd/cwK4
Now OpenOffice seems to want to bring the whole computer down -- may have decided for me.
OpenOffice.org: Way faster than Apple's Numbers, but crashes a LOT. Trying to decide which to use.
17 posts up on ResearchBlogging.org referencing PLoS ONE: Spectacular synchroblogging event! http://is.gd/cv9T
The top 50 Science Blog posts of the year! http://is.gd/euTe And I wrote one of them! http://is.gd/m2p
Watching the autozone liberty bowl. Why are there still minor bowl games in January?
If you're on digg, could you digg this? http://tinyurl.com/7j27xd
The bathroom survey is ready: Is it okay to use the "forbidden" restroom? http://is.gd/ereO
Finished writing the bathroom survey. Now I'm writing the CogDaily post to introduce it.
In starbucks. Just explained twitter to someone. Not sure if I was quite able to get the point across.
Writing a Casual Fridays study about public restrooms. Trying to decide how... um... distasteful to be.
Back from New York. It's cold and rainy in North Carolina.
Saw "In the Heights" last night -- very fun musical!
Last night: had amazing italian food and saw Gypsy
In New York apartment rental. Annoyed that my daughter's MacBook gets better wifi reception than my MacBook Air
In Gettysburg. Had some of the worst fish and chips ever. Yes, I know, I know...
Getting ready to leave for NYC. We'll be stopping in Gettysburg on the way up.
Family off to church. Me (atheist) at home doing dishes.
